intro: Solenostemma arghel, commonly known as the white-rooted milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Solenostemma arghel thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
